María tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo y 3 menores hijos en una comunidad rural perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande – Piura, una zona agrícola productora de mango y limón.

María se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, porcino y  aves de corral desde hace más de cuatro años. Ella los cría en corrales ubicados cerca de su domiclio, alimentándolos con granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos obtienen el tamaño y peso adecuado los comercializa en el mercado local. Con las ganancias obtenidas, María ayuda a su esposo, que es agricultor, en los gastos del hogar. 

María solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado y de ovejas para ampliar su negocio y seeguir creciendo como empresaria, esta acción le permitirá obtener mayores ganancias que utilizará para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Ella ya ha tenido un crédito financiado a través de Kiva anteriormente y le ha ido muy bien, por ello se siente bastante agradecida con las personas que en aquel entonces la apoyaron. María también agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyarán en este préstamo.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three young children in a rural community located in the District of Tambogrande - Piura, a farming area that produces mangoes and limes.

María has been raising sheep, pigs, and poultry for more than four years. The animals are kept in pens near her home and fed a diet of grains and natural grasses. When the animals reach an adequate size and weight, they are sold at the local market. María uses the profits she earns to help her husband, a farmer, with the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,500 PEN in order to buy balanced feed and sheep to expand her business and help her continue growing as an entrepreneur. As a result of this action, María will be able to generate more income that will help to improve her quality of life. She received a previous loan through Kiva and did very well. For this reason, she is grateful to everyone who supported her on that loan. She would also like to thank in advance those lenders who will be supporting her on this loan.

loans.use: to buy sheep and balanced feed for all of her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items like saucepans, food items, etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo con el cual vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación pequeña y con paredes de ladrillo, la misma esta ubicada en la zona Alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja vendiendo camisetas de forma ambulante por que no cuenta con un puesto de venta fijo, trabaja por más de diez horas y poniendo en riesgo su vida ya que corre el riesgo de que le roben su mercadería o tener un accidente vehicular ya que  transitan muchos vehículos y con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación  de su hijo ya que aun es muy pequeño.
El crédito lo necesita para la compra de paja, alambre tejido, estuco, refacción del tumbado de su casa ya que se encuentra muy destrozado y quiere darle seguridad a su hijo más que todo en tiempo de lluvias.
El sueño de Gladis, es poder mejorar sus ingresos y de esta forme independizarse para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Es la primera vez que solicita el crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Gladys is a single mother, and she has one child.  They live in her parents’ house, occupying only one small room with brick walls.  The house is located in the Alto Llojeta area of the city of La Paz.

She currently gets income because she works selling t-shirts in an itinerant manner.  She does not have a fixed sales stand, and she works for over ten hours a day.  When she works she is putting her life at risk because she runs the risk that she will be robbed of her merchandise.  There is also the risk that she will have an accident with a vehicle because a lot of vehicles go by.  With the little that she earns she needs to cover the food expenses for her son because he is still very little.

She needs the loan to buy straw, wire mesh, and plaster to repair her house, which is in very bad condition.  She wants to provide safety for her son, especially during the rainy season.

Gladis’s dream is to be able to improve her income.  This way she would become independent in order to improve her family’s quality of life.

This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy straw, wire mesh, and plaster to repair her house, which is in very bad condition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Rosarios De Achocalla Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “ROSARIOS DE ACHOCALLA” inicia su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, esta compuesta por seis integrantes donde la señora Micarelly es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, venta de golosinas, venta de verduras, costura de chamarras, remo de botes, 
La señora Micarelly cuenta que es la primera vez que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por una promotora; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, mismo que trabaja hace varios años.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de víveres) los que comprarán de las galerías de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rosarios de Achocalla" starts its first cycle in the regional office of Villa Exaltación. The group is comprised of six members with Micarelly as president. The team carries out different activities, such as: neighborhood store, snack sales, vegetable sales, sewing jackets, and making boat paddles.

Micarelly tells us that it is the first time she joins a communal bank within Pro Mujer. She was invited by a promoter. Her business is a neighborhood store, which she has been doing for many years.

The loan will be used to increase her capital (buying groceries), which she will buy from the market in the city of El Alto. Then, she will sell it from her local store. Her business helps her family to get ahead since she has a partner and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes their training in health and credit.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Edgard David

texts.es: Edgard de 23 años de edad vive en union libre con Darlin; Edgard trabaja para la municipalidad como policia, brindando seguridad y resguardando el patrimonio de la ciudad.  Esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo de iniciar la construccion de un pequeño cuarto para tener privacidad con su familia, pero como el monto es pequeño unicamente le alcanza para comprar una parte de los materiales.  Plantea que posterior hara un nuevo credito con el cual espera ya alcanzar la construccion deseada y asi brindar comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Edgard is 23 years old and in a common-law relationship with Darlin. He works for the municipality as a police officer, providing security and safeguarding the city's assets.

Edgard is requesting his first loan in order to start the construction of a small room so that his family can have privacy. Since the amount is small, he will only be able to buy some of the materials. Edgard says that he plans to apply for a new loan later on in hopes of acquiring enough materials so that his family will be comfortable.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a room.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, a 46-year-old married father of three children aged 9, 13 and 20, has been operating a butcher shop to earn a living for 12 years.  He works hard to support his family and educate his children. 

Through Faulu Kenya, George has learnt how to manage his finances through training in financial management. He is requesting a loan for 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy meat, and hopes to expand his business within five years,

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif is 33 years old and married with three daughters.  He sells dishes in his shop. Asif has eight years of experience in this field, which shows him to be a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The dishes he sells are very popular as dowry items among people and are in high demand, especially for bribes. His monthly profit from selling goods is 120 AZN. His wife helps him to sell products in their shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of the good location, in the central bazaar of his home city.

Asif would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose he applied for 1000 AZN. He will purchase  additional dishes and diversify his inventory. He successfully completed two loans and AqroInvest CU trusts him!

loans.use: to buy  additional dishes

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif is 50 years old and married with three children.  He sells food products as macaroni, butter, cookies, sugar, tea, candies and beverages in his shop. Asif has 14 years of experience in this field, which makes him a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food products he sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 130 AZN. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location, in the central bazaar of his home city. The profit he earns is not enough to reinvest it into the business and cover his customers` demand and he is suffering for this reason. Being the main source of income, his profit is used for family needs. 

Asif would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose he applied for 1500 AZN. He will purchase additional foodstuffs and diversify his inventory. This will be his 3rd  loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more food products

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia works hard to support her family. Eufemia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 4,100 through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Eufemia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, she helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her beauty salon business. She has been operating her business for over eighteen years. In these years of experience, she has obtained good reputation among her customers. Her salon is renowned in her area where every day she deals with many customers.  

She is a mother of one daughter who reads at 6th standard. Salma wants to give her daughter a better future, which is why she works hard. Her aim is to allow her daughter to enjoy all the things in life which Salma never had in hers. 
 
Salma’s husband is a rickshaw driver. He is also very hard worker and drives his rickshaw for 8  to 10 hours a day and provides transportation facilities to the passengers. 

Salma will use the loan to purchase beauty products, face creams and make up material for her beauty salon business. She is very positive about its business progress after this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, face products and make up items for a beauty salon business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. Violeta is married and has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.

Violeta is borrowing PHP 4,100  through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a back-up light in case of emergency.

Violeta is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Monico

texts.en:
Monico works hard to support eight children. He is married and has a business buying and selling tobacco in the Philippines.

Monico requested a PHP 4,100 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. He is getting the solar lamp because he wants to provide his children with a bright light when they study at night.

Monico is aware that by using the solar lamp, he is not only saving money, he is also helping the environment and reducing his family's health and hazard risks.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is thirty-nine years old and married with four children.

Riza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Riza has borrowed and paid for six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Riza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Eugenia works hard to support her family. She has a barbecue-vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food-vending. Eugenia is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Eugenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Yamileth Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Yamileth   gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Afodenic sigue construyendo su gran sueño, su casa propia, quien con esfuerzo y mucho trabajo, a podido  levantarla y sus planes a futuro es poder terminarla y junto a su hijo poder tener un hogar digno. Con este nuevo financiamiento podrá comprar materiales como: Hierro, Cemento, Bloques  para continuar  levantando su casa.
Agradece a Afodenic por brindarle nuevamente este crédito y sobre todo por la confianza en ella depositada.
texts.en: Mrs. Yamileth, thanks to the support that she has been given by Afodenic, continues building her great dream, her own house.  With great effort and much work, she has been able to put up the house and her future plan is to be able to finish it and together with her child have a dignified home.  With this new loan she will be able to purchase materials like iron, cement, and concrete blocks in order to continuing putting up the house.  She is thankful to Afodenic for offering her once again a loan and above all for the confidence shown in her.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, quiere comprarse más materiales para el negocio como la leña, maíz, cal, bolsas, ella se decidió porque considera que través de los préstamos ha logrado mejorar el negocio, ya que el anterior le dio los ingresos necesarios para aumentar el inventario y seguir en la producción.
En su familia todo se mantiene igual, sus ingresos si han mejorado para cubrir algunos gastos necesarios de su familia.
texts.en:
Reina wants to buy herself more materials for her business, such as firewood, corn, lime and bags. She decided to do this because she believes that thgrough the loans she has succeeded in improving her business. The previous loan provided her with the necessary income to increase her inventory and continue production.

Everthing is still the same with her family. Her income has improved for covering some necessary family expenses.

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, lime and bags.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan was born in 1973 and has a small child. Her husband and she are workers for a factory for two years. To improve her family's income each month, her couple also sell fast food in the market. Her monthly income is 3,000,000 VND and the total income of her family is 8,000,000 VND. 

She has participated in the credit program of SEDA since 2005. The last cycle, she borrowed 8.938.000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she needs a loan amount of 9,810,000 VND to buy new tables, chairs for her small restaurant

loans.use: to buy new tables, chairs for her small restaurant

loans.name: Hoach

texts.en:
Hoach was born in 1964. She has two children who are married. Her husband grows rice and raises fish and chickens for a living. Mrs. Hoach has been selling dried food for 10 years. Each month, she can earn about 3,000,000 VND and  the total income of her family is about 5,000,000 VND. 

Mrs Hoach joined the credit program of SEDA in 2006. In her previous loan cycle, she had a loan of 7,630,000 VND and repaid on the due date. This time, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND in order to enlarge her small restaurant.

loans.use: to enlarge her small restaurant

loans.name: Tubekimwe Group

texts.fr:
Salomé fait partie du groupe Tubekimwe et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle  est âgée de 47 ans et est mariée à Balthazar. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants, âgés  de 9 à 25 ans, dont 2 étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de boutique depuis  17 ans. 

Elle est à son sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  faire le commerce d’importation et voir se enfants terminer les études.
texts.en:
Salomé is a member of the Tubekimwe group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 47 years old and married to Balthazar. They have five children aged between nine and 25. Two of the children are in school.

Salomé has been running a shop for 17 years and this is her sixth loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy more products for resale in her shop. This will increase her earnings. 

In the next few years, she would like to start importing goods and help her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy items for resale in her shop to increase her earnings.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan is a resident from Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is 46 years old and has a single child. She, together with her husband, sells fruit and rice from a rented booth in a local market of the province. They usually buy fruit in bulk from their suppliers in the evening time to store at home before they take the fruit to sell in the market. From this business, Kan is able to make in income approximately USD 4.00 per day. Kan uses her generated income to pay for her daily food and expenses.

Kan wants to manage her business successfully through her determination and full devotion to the business. Due to the shortage of capital, Kan is now asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to supplement her capital to buy stock of fruit and rice to sell in her store. This loan will enable her to sustain her business and make a stable income for the family. In the future, she plans to save money to expand her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy stock of fruit and rice to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 51 years old and married with one child. He works hard to provide for his family. He runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Anthony has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. He has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from raising livestock and selling rice.

Anthony aspires to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is forty years old, married, and has three children.

Haidar has owned a food market since 2004, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish and dairy products. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan of $3,000 in order to buy two refrigerators and a small generator. He is aiming to increase his profits and provide a better living standard for his family.

loans.use: to buy two refrigerators and a small generator.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew used his previous loan from Faulu Kenya to buy electronic items for his video show business. This loan had a great impact on his business because he managed to attract more customers. He used the additional income from his business to add stock to the cosmetics he also sells.   

Andrew hopes to grow his business in the future. He has requested another loan of 100,000 KES to buy movies and a computer for use in his business.

loans.use: To buy movies and a computer for use in his business.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man. He’s living with his parents and two siblings. His father is the main income provider of the family and he cooperates with him financially in collaboration with his siblings in order to live in better life conditions. Said has been working as a photographer since 2010. He works on his own schedule with multiple events such as weddings, parties, concerts and many other special occasions. He works with high proficiency and he is well recognized in his town and its surrounding. 

Today, he’s applying for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of photo albums and other required products such as frames, etc. One of his greatest dreams is to have a photography shop of his own since through this opportunity he will be able to grow his business which will return higher profits to him.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of photo albums and other required products such as frames, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This is Ali, 20 years old. He’s a Lebanese single man living with his parents. Ali has a wonderful father who always seeks to offer them a good way of living. Despite his young age, Ali was ready to start his own business and take some responsibilities off of his father.  He has owned a silver shop since 2009. He sells a variety of silver items and different kinds of accessories. Because his shop is located in a good place, Ali has gained a fair number of customers. 

Today, in order to increase his sales, he decided to take out a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added silver items and other related accessories. He notes that this will definitely allow him to earn superior income and therefore help his father with their family expenses. Ali is really ambitious and looks forward to improving his business and growing in this occupation.

loans.use: to purchase added silver items and other related accessories

loans.name: Régine Grace

texts.fr: Régine Grace est une jeune Camerounaise âgée de 33 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant qui va déjà à l'école. elle mène une activité de confection de vêtement depuis 14 ans. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter une surfileuse car ne disposant d'une, elle se trouve souvent obligée de confier ses travaux de surfilage à d'autres couturiers; ce qui réduit sa marge bénéficiaire. Elle voudrait à la longue agrandir son activité et employer dans la mesure du possible d'autres personnes.
texts.en:
Régine Grace is a young woman from Cameroon. She is 33 years old, single and the mother of one child, who is already in school. 

Régine Grace has been in the clothing business for 14 years. She would like to use this loan to buy a sewing machine for overseaming. At the moment she does not own her own machine, so she has to give overseaming tasks to other sewers, which reduces her profit margin. 

In the longterm, Régine Grace would like to expand her business and, if possible, employ other people.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.en:
Apolinar always liked antiques, but never considered turning his hobby of collecting and trading antiques into a career. He started out selling items from his home – in between shift work at his day job. But about a year ago, he opened his San Juan, Texas business, C. Trading Post, where he sells and trades almost anything, but tries to stick with antiques. Since then, his business has expanded and necessitated this loan.

When Apolinar decided to move his business from home to a store, he was informed by the San Juan Economic Development Corporation about Accion Texas Inc., which eventually led to his visiting an Accion office to apply for a business loan. There are no other trading posts in his hometown, which helps Apolinar gain customers and leaves him with a hand up on future competition. The main idea of opening this business was to ensure he had a job, but now he has a career he loves. 

Apolinar said he wants to create an enjoyable shopping experience. The loan will therefore fund start-up costs including interior and exterior décor, lining the building with insulation, and repairing the floor. Currently, he works alone, but as his business expands, Apolinar plans to employ another person.

loans.use: to remodel the floors and walls of his new shop.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre de 23 años de edad y vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas llamada La Danta.  La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
Diego está solicitando un préstamo de ₡500.000 (seiscientos mil colones), para  la cosecha de frijol y darle mantenimiento a su siembra por medio de abono y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos de plagas y hongos que puedan afectar la producción mientras se desarrolla,  gracias a este préstamo podrá seguir desarrollando esta actividad y sembrando estos productos pues esta labor es precisamente la que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia. 
El pertenece como muchos otros agricultores de la zona a la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Diego is a 23-year-old gentleman who lives with his family in a small community in southern Costa Rica called La Danta, which is located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas.  The local economy is based on agricultural activities such as growing tubers, coffee, corn, beans, as well as raising cattle. 

Diego is requesting a loan in the amount of 500,000 CRC for planting beans and providing care for his crops.  He will buy compost and fungicides in order to protect his crops against pests and fungus that could impact production while the crops are developing.  Thanks to this loan, Diego can continue developing his business and planting these products.  His work is what enables him to sustain his family.  

Diego, like many other farmers, is a member of La Danta Communal Credit Enterprise, S.A., one of the 150 credit organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a longtime Crimean farmer. He has a son and a daughter. Their ages are 29 and 24. Both of the kids help out their parents in the field. Michael also has a wife, who is also employed full time at their farm. Primarily, Michael grows crops to feed livestock, such as chicken and cows. Their income comes from the sale of eggs and milk. Recently, Michael has decided to diversify his farming and begin to grow raspberries to sell. Growing berries is a more delicate task than growing food for livestock. He needs help to finance some irrigation machinery in order to provide adequate care for his raspberry crop. In the future, he hopes to renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase irrigation machinery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a greenhouse

loans.name: Hicran

texts.en:
Hicran is twenty-nine-year-old very kind and friendly young man. He is single and lives with his parents. He has raised livestock for the last five years. He sells them for meat, which is very popular among local people. Many popular dishes like dolma and pilov are made of meat. People consider it very healthy and digestible.

Hicran usually buys calves, raises and fattens them and sells them for profitable price. His monthly income is 100 AZN and this is the only financial income in his family. Keeping a family and covering any children's needs will be a very hard job. Looking after animals is very hard and means that he has to spend a lot of time outside. The climate in the region is very austere, bur Hicran is very positive man and his mother supports and helps him a lot.

He has applied for 700 AZN loan in order to buy two calves. As summer is very close it is good time to fatten animals and sell them for profitable price for wedding parties, of which there are many during this season.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Sajed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is forty years old, married, and has three children.

Sajed is a hairdresser for men and has owned a barber shop since 2007. He has a sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan of $2,400 to renovate and decorate the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate and decorate the shop.

loans.name: Kan's Group

texts.en:
To make a living, Kan and her husband have been farming rice for thirty years. Kan is sixty-two years old and has four children, one of whom is still living with the family and working in the rice field. Kan's group consists of four members, each of whom borrowed one million Khmer Riel from VisionFund , and each of whom has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. 

As the group leader, Kan used her portion prepare her land and to buy fertilizers. She strongly hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so that she can help her children with their children's school fees as Kan realizes the importance of education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to prepare her farmland.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is 41 years old, a married man with two sons. He is a market vendor and sells different kinds of  merchandise like shampoo, soap, detergents and so on. He has 14 years of experience and has a deep knowledge of the market and demand of clients. 

The food products he sells are very popular among people and in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 110 AZN.  He keeps shop on his own - purchasing products and bringing them to the shop. This is the only financial income in his family. Iman is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location, in the central bazaar of his home town. 

He applied for 1000  AZN loan to purchase more cosmetic products and diversify his range of goods to cover customers` demand. This will be Iman's 2nd loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To assist with paying for renovations and a separate entrance to her daycare.

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s sales business. Her husband is a professional salesman and particularly deals with cosmetics. He purchases cosmetics wholesale and sells to different cosmetics shop-owners at a profit. He has been in this business for over ten years. With the loan, he will purchase cosmetics and increase his sales.  

Saima herself operates her sewing business. She has no children, so she keeps herself busy by doing sewing and household activities.  

She is very hopeful that her husband’s profit will be double in size by investing the loan money into his business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Valery Giscard

texts.fr:
Valery Giscard est un jeune Camerounais âgé de 27 ans, célibataire et père d'un enfant. il dispose d'un secrétariat bureautique dans un quartier de la capitale économique depuis 12 mois et bénéficie de 18 mois d'expérience dans le domaine. ceci il est encore jeune dans cette activité, d'autant plus qu'il ne dispose pas en sa propriété de tout le matériel nécessaire à l'instar de l'ordinateur qu'il prend en location; il voudrait ainsi avec ce crédit s'en acheter un.
Il a pour ambition d'ouvrir un cyber café à coté de son secrétariat.
texts.en:
Valery Giscard is a young man from Cameroon. He is 27 years old, single and the father of one child. 

He has been running a secretarial business in a district of the economic capital for 12 months, and has a total of 18 months experience in this field. However he is still fairly new to the business and does not own all the equipment he requires, such as a computer. At the moment he rents a computer, but would like to use this loan to purchase his own.

His ambition is to open a cyber café next door to his secretarial business.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Placido

texts.es:
El señor Placido de 47 años de edad, es casado vive con sus 6 hijos, tres de ellos  ya están independizados, vive junto con su esposa en su casa ubicada en una aldea de Coyolito, al sur de Honduras, se dedica a la pesca, venta de mariscos y cría de ganado.
Don Placido solicita el préstamo para la compra de un terreno ya que le venden una propiedad pegada a las que ya tiene y desea comprarla porque su cría de ganado ha crecido.
Con la ayuda del préstamo  ajustara a comprar ese terreno que viene ha fortalecer su patrimonio.
Don Placido su sueño es tener un buen equipo de pesca y comprar más propiedades para el ganado.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2012
texts.en:
Placido is 47 years old and married. He lives with his wife and has six children, but three of them already live independently. Their house is located in the village of Coyolito, in southern Honduras. He works fishing, selling seafood, and raising livestock.
Placido is requesting the loan in order to purchase a piece of land, since there is a property for sale which is adjacent to the ones he already owns, and he would like to buy it because the livestock he is raising has grown.
This loan will help him have enough to buy that piece of land, which will strengthen his estate.
Placido's dream is to have good fishing equipment and buy more land for livestock.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April, 2012

loans.use: to purchase land for his livestock and his business.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mrs Mai was born in 1957 and has two children. Her son is married and her daughter is a worker, while her husband is a farmer. Not only grow rice but also she goes to small business. She buys and resells iron scrap to recycle them. She has this job for four years.  She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 Vietnamdong(VND).Mrs Mai received her first loan from SEDA in 2003. The last cycle, she borrowed 6.322.000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy more iron scrap to recycle them.

loans.use: to buy more iron scrap to recycle them

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
This is Mercy, who is 47 years old and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Noel, her business partner, and a mother to three children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating their business, a tire shop. At this time, Mercy is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mercy's husband handles the labor work, such as vulcanizing and tire repair for some vehicles. Mercy handles the finances, inventories, and promotion of the business. The couple offers tire replacement, tire repair, and tire sales. Their regular customers are vehicle owners from the local community. Mercy earns a minimum of 800 Philippine pesos (PHP) in service fees every day.

To help her continue operating the business, Mercy is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy tires,vulcanizing materials and supplies needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mercy hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for tires and vulcanizing materials and supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is from San Carlos, Tukuran. She is 46 years old. Cirila is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Cirila owns and operates a business venture, selling specialty food products in the local community. 

Cirila has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns 3,500 a month for these activities. Cirila is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Cirila is new in GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en: Ligaya is 44 years old. She is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has six children. Ligaya manages a gardening business for a living. Every month, she receives 15,000 PHP, enough money to cover everyday expenses. In 2011, Ligaya joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase farm fertilizers. Ligaya hopes to increase farm production now and in subsequent cycles of production in order to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buko salad business in the Philippines.

Carolina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her buko salad business.

She has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Carolina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and renovate their family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her buko salad business.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is a 64-year-old married woman. She is living in Tangub City, Philippines, where her large corn plantation is located. She has been cultivating this land since she was 40 years of age. She doesn't mind the scratches and itches brought by this kind of plant, for as long as she can earn income, Felipa goes for it. 

She normally receives 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month. Felipa joined GDMPC in 2011. She is requesting a loan of 6,200 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next planting. When the crop is harvested, the revenue  will be used to expand the business to earn more income and to sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en: Jovelyn is married and has two children. She is 32 years old and resides at Caniangan, Tangub City, Philippines. Jovelyn plants and harvests bananas and corn for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP from her work. She has requested a loan of 5,900 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop. In 2011, Jovelyn joined GDMPC. In the future, she would like to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.  Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.  She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, soap, snack food, noodles, and school supplies. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
This is Adoracion. She is 60 years old and a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a mother of 2 children, one working, the other staying at home. Together with her children, she manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Adoracion operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5 worth of cooking oil, or a single egg. Adoracion earns income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also does direct selling business -- she sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. She earns a minimum of PHP17,500 in net sales a week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP50,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory and will also use it to buy products for the direct-selling business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Adoracion hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and other products.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida. She is 42 years old and a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Emilio, who is a vendor. At this time, she is working hard to meet their financial expenses.

Nida is a coconut vendor. Most coconuts in the Philippines are sold by street vendors pushing deep wooden carts. The coconuts are served either by cutting one end and just putting a straw in so the coconuts themselves serve as containers or by offering both the juice and edible part of the coconuts in plastic with a straw. Regular customers are those who are thirsty and those who want to refresh themselves from the heat of the sun. Nida earns a minimum of 1200 Philippine pesos (PHP) per day.

Nida is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy tires, wood, nails and paint for a new cart, coconuts, and a cooler for the coconut juice that she'll sell separately. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Nida hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy coconuts.

loans.name: Guerlita

texts.en:
Guerlita is 61 years old and married with 2 children.

Guerlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, diapers, cigarettes and other groceries.

Guerlita has been in this business for 6 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Guerlita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an irrigation system

loans.name: Zumrud

texts.en:
Zumrud is a 45-year-old widow who raises her two children alone. She is a farmer, and she cultivates seasonal fruits and vegetables. Zumrud has more than 15 years of experience in this field, which makes her a very skilled farmer. Raising crops takes a lot of strength and outdoor labor, so her son helps her with her work. 

Zumrud usually sells her crops in the central bazaar. In Azerbaijan, people use fresh produce every day; many national dishes are made of fruits and vegetables, like pilau, dolma, and fresh punch. 

Zumrud's monthly income is 120 AZN. She needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of her produce and increase her monthly turnover. For this purpose, Zumrud applied for 900 AZN.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: My

texts.en:
My was born in 1968. She lives in Tien Kha village with her husband and a child. Her husband is a builder. He has an income of 4.000.000 Vietnam dong per month. Her son has a job and has an income. Her main job is farming. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. 

Since 2006 she has participated in SEDA and always pays loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9.810.000 VND to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Yat is a farmer and lives in Saang district. She has been in this business for thirty years. Yat is sixty-two years old and a married mother of six, three of whom are dependent on her. 

Yat's group consists of two female members. Yat has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles while her fellow member is new to VisionFund. 

Acting as a leader, Yat used her portion of 1 million Khmer Riel to buy fertilizers for her rice crops and strongly hopes that this loan will allow her to increase her rice crops and therefore sell the products for higher price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a single man living with his parents and two siblings. He’s a twenty-one-year-old hard-working man, looking to help his father to satisfy the family's needs. Ali’s siblings are also doing the best they can to bring added income to the family and they are ready to offer help whenever needed. Ali has many years of experience in his present job. He’s an independent painter who works upon client’s requests. He works on different projects and always tries to offer his customers the best results ever. He’s known for being well-organized and on time. 

Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a car for his business. He will be using the car to facilitate his transport and make it easier to move his painting tools and supplies in a proper way. Ali is grateful for all the good things God has given him. In the near future, he hopes to take on more projects maybe outside the country if this will help him learn new designs and better develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase a car for his business.

loans.name: Panah

texts.en:
Panah is a forty-four-year-old man, married, with three children. He raises fruits and vegetables in his garden and has been doing it for the last twelve years. He is very experienced farmer and has deep knowledge of land and how to manage it. He was not able to find job for several years and than decided to start his own business.  

Panah usually raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for profitable price in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people prefer to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. Also one of the favorite national dishes, Dolma, is made of fresh eggplants, peppers and tomatoes. His monthly income from this business is 120 AZN. This is the only source of income in his family.

Now Panah would like to invest more capital in his business and purchase seeds and fertilizers. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. As his business is the only source of income in his family, he hopes that the loan will improve his family's life. This will be his third loan, and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario, es casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia la misma ubicada en la zona Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Mario, estudió hasta terminar la secundaria y actualmente trabaja como empleado en un hospital público por más de diez horas al día y a veces cubre turnos toda la noche ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de educación, alimentación y servicios básicos de su familia  que no cuenta con otros ingresos.
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de trámites de jubilación de su empleo ya que trabajo muchos años y le toca jubilarse por que el trabajo que realiza es muy sacrificado. 
El sueño de Mario, es jubilarse y con eso poner un negocio en su domicilio que le permita descansar un poco ya que es mayor de edad y necesita ingresos para seguir ayudando a su familia.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Mario is married and has two school age children.  They live in their own house in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz.  Mario has a high school education.

He currently works as an employee of a public hospital.  He works over ten hours a day, and sometimes he covers the all night shifts. This is the only thing he has to cover his family’s expenses for education, food, and basic services.  He does not have other income.

He needs the loan to pay for the paperwork to process retirement from his job.  He has worked a lot of years, and he will now retire because the work he does is very difficult.

Mario’s dream is to retire and upon retiring set up a business in his house.  This would allow him to rest a little because he is elderly, and he needs income to continue helping his family.

This is the fourth time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay to process his retirement.

loans.name: Jantetelco Group

texts.es: La señora Angela Josefina tiene 48  años de edad, ella vive con su esposo quien es taxista, ella tiene 4 hijos, 3 mujeres y un varon. una joven mayor de edad ya trabaja, un varón en la secundaria una joven en bachilleres y una niña en la primaria, ella vende perfumes y cosméticos de Jafra y zapatos todo por catalogo, ella inicio su negocio hace 2 años, ella empezó a vender por pedidos sale a ofrecer sus productos con sus vecinos y amigos, su negocio es importante porque va sacando ganancias para cubrir las necesidades de su casa, a ella le gusta este negocio le da la oportunidad de conoce a más personas a ella le gusta tener amistad con las personas. Su negocio es conocido por dar facilidad de pagos a sus clientes. Ella está contenta con el préstamo que va a recibir le va a ayudar a crecer su negocio y dar mejor servicio a sus clientes, sus sueños y esperanzas son que sus hijos sigan estudiando. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad gracias por apoyarnos con sus préstamos cuando más lo necesitamos, gracias por confiar en nosotros y vamos a pagar bien para que nos sigan apoyando con sus préstamos”.
texts.en:
Sra. Angela Josefina is 48 years old.  She lives with her husband, who is a taxi driver.  Angela has four children, three daughters and a son.  Her oldest daughter is already working, her son is in high school, another daughter is a high school graduate, and her youngest daughter is in elementary school.  Angela sells perfumes and cosmetics produced by Jafra and shoes, all through catalogs.  She started this business two years ago.  At first, she generated orders by offering these products to her neighbors and friends.  Her business is important because it generates earnings to cover her household needs.  Angela enjoys this line of work because it gives her the opportunity to meet more people since she likes being friendly with others.  Her business is known for providing payment options to her customers.  

Angela is pleased with the loan that she will receive because it will help grow her business so that she can provide better service to her customers.  Her hopes and dreams include seeing her children continue their studies.  

The members of the group would like to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "Thank you for supporting us with these loans when we need them the most.  We are grateful for your trust in us and we will submit our repayments promptly so that you can continue supporting us with these loans."

loans.use: to buy perfumes, cosmetics, and shoes.

loans.name: Grupo Los Globos Group

texts.es:
El "Grupo Los Globos" está integrado por 9 personas: Lázara que vende antojitos mexicanos, Azucena venta de abarrotes, Alejandro tiene una peluquería, Sonia venta de perfumería, Israel albañilería, Dolores venta de tortillas, Irene venta de bolsas de mano, Juan Carlos venta de ropa y Perfecta venta de ropa también. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en  la comunidad de Vicente donde la gente se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de caña  para la producción de azúcar.

La señora Azucena tiene la edad de 35 años de edad, estudio la preparatoria, se encuentra casada con el señor José Luis que tiene la ocupación de obrero, ellos tiene 2 hijos, uno asiste a la secundaria y otro a la primaria. Doña Azucena nos dice que siempre le ha gustado trabajar, ella inicio vendiendo perfumería y zapatos por catálogo casa por casa con sus amigos de la comunidad, también nos dice que aunque vendía por catálogo siempre había tenido la ilusión de tener una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y con mucho esfuerzo hace un años abrió un tiendita de abarrotes en su hogar. Ella espera que su negocio crezca día a día ya que quiere darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella nos dice que aunque ya tiene su tiendita de abarrotes sigue vendiendo por las tardes sus perfumes y zapatos para tener más entradas de dinero en su hogar, Ella necesita este crédito para la compra de jabón en polvo, frijoles, arroz, galletas, refrescos, cloro, dulces, jugos, Sabritas (papas fritas y botanas) y productos enlatados para posteriormente venderlos. Doña Azucena espera que con este crédito su negocio pueda crecer y que día a día pueda tener más clientes, ella se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundación por la confianza que han puesto en ella.
texts.en:
The “Los Globos” (The Balloons) group is composed of nine persons: Lázara who sells Mexican fast-food snacks, Azucena who sells groceries, Alejandro who has a barber shop, Sonia who sells perfumery, Israel who works in construction, Dolores who sells tortillas, Irene who sells pocketbooks, Juan Carlos who sells clothes and Perfecta who also sells clothes.  The group is located in the community of Vicente where people work growing sugarcane for sugar production.

Azucena, 35, completed high-school.  She’s married to José Luis who is a laborer.  They have two children, one attending secondary school and one in elementary school. Azucena tells us that she’s always liked to work and started out selling perfumery and shoes via catalogue house to house among her friends in the community.  She also tells us that although she sold via catalogue she’d always had the dream of having her own little grocery store at home and with much effort a few years ago succeeded in opening it.  She hopes that her business will grow day to day and wants to give her family a better quality of life and to help her husband with household expenses.

She tells us that even though she already has her little grocery store she continues selling her perfume and shoes in the evenings to have additional income coming into the home.  She needs this loan to buy powdered detergent, beans, rice, cookies, soft-drinks, chlorine bleach, candy, juice, Sabritas (potato chips and snacks) and canned goods to then sell.

Azucena hopes with this loan that her business will be able to grow and that day to day she’ll have more customers.  She is very grateful to the Fundación for the trust they’ve placed in her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Hok

texts.en:
Hok, 50, is a married woman who is responsible for five children. Four of her children are married, while the other is single and lives with her in the Kampong Chhnang province. To earn a living, Hok and her husband help each other in the business of making pots and other containers out of clay. They wholesale their products to regular customers, who then retail them in local markets. In addition, Hok’s husband sometimes travels through the province selling their products from a horse-pulled trailer. 

Recently one of Hok’s children began a preparation course at the Korean language institute in Phnom Penh. He wants to pass his exam and go to work as a laborer in Korea, where he can earn much more profit than in Cambodia. To pay for her child’s language course, Hok would like to borrow 900,000 KHR from HKL. She hopes to help her child achieve his goals. She is very thankful for the help of lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her son's language course.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 39-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and five children. Ali has owned a mini-market in his town since 2008. and he provides his customers with fresh fruits and vegetables and vital food provisions such as canned and bottled products, bread, drinks, towels, and dairy products. His prices are fair enough, and that’s what catches the attention of passing customers. 

Today, Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his store’s inventory. Additional stock will help him to increase his sales and therefore his income. Ali works enthusiastically to earn a good income so he can satisfy the needs of his large family.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory.

loans.name: Reisly

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Reisly works hard to support her family. She has a shell-crafting business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from coconut wine.  Reisly is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her shell-crafting business.

Reisly has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shell-crafting business

loans.name: Madinakhon

texts.en: Madinakhon is a young woman. Since childhood she has liked animals, and that’s why she takes care of livestock at her house. She has 10 big animals. Also, she has a yard with 150 fruit trees. Fruits from Madinakhon’s yard are very sweet and attract many customers. Madinakhon raises corn and herbs for her livestock. She is in this business to her help parents. They are proud of Madinakhon. Madinakhon is young, but she is a widow. She has many plans and wants to realize all of them. Her aim is to buy livestock to develop her business.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Las Mojarritas Group

texts.es:
Las Mojarritas es uno de los grupos más unidos y numerosos, actualmente cuanta con 16 integrantes, cada uno de ellos desempeña una actividad económica con la intención de tener mejores condiciones de vida. Este grupo está  ubicado a la orilla de una gran laguna en la comunidad de Cerro Mojarra la Capilla y su gente se dedica principalmente a la pesca y venta de mojarra. 

Margarita tiene 52 años y está casado con Navor, un vendedor. Ellos  tienen 4 hijos que son estudiantes. Margarita desde hace 3 años abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la calle principal de su comunidad con el propósito de tener un ingreso de dinero y así poder darles a sus hijos estudios y mejor vida. Ella abre su negocio todos los días desde muy temprano y platica que le gusta tenerlo surtido para que los clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan y vuelvan a comprarle. Además, debido a que la tienda está ubicada al lado de la carretera vende un poco más con las personas que acuden a comprar mojarra a su comunidad. Margarita tiene pensado invertir este crédito en la compra  el aceite de cocina, alimentos enlatados, dulces, detergente, jabón, jugos, refrescos, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, queso, crema, leche, chiles y otros productos para vender. Su meta es tener algún día la oportunidad de ampliar más su negocio  para así brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Los demás integrantes del grupo y sus actividades son:

Yocunda - venta de abarrotes 
Maria - venta de pescado 
Margarita - venta de pescado 
Natalia - venta de ropa
Rafael - venta de pescado 
Nohemi - venta de antojitos 
Maria Paula - venta de pollos
Alejandra - venta de abarrotes 
Adela - venta de pescado 
Marcelino - venta de paletas heladas
Angel Roberto - venta de pescado 
Maria - venta de pescado 
Jaqueline venta de comida 
Luis venta de abarrotes 
Yadira venta de abarrotes
texts.en:
"Las Mojarritas" is one of the larger and more unified groups.  It currently has 16 members.  Each one has developed a business activity with the intention of having better living conditions.  This group is from the community of Cerro Mojarra La Capilla, which is located on the shore of a large lake.  Most of the people are fishermen or fishmongers who sell "mojarra" (a fish similar to tilapia).  

Margarita is 52 years old and married to Navor, a vendor.  They have four children who are students.  Three years ago, Margarita opened a small grocery store along the main street in her community in hopes of generating income to provide her children with an education and a better life.  She opens her business very early and says she likes having it well-stocked because her customers can always find what they are looking for and return to buy more.  In addition, it should be noted that Margarita's store is located on the edge of the road, so she is able to sell to a few more people who are also coming to buy fish in her community.  Margarita has plans to invest her loan in the purchase of cooking oil, canned foods, candy, detergent, soap, juices, soft drinks, beans, rice, sugar, cheese, cream, milk, chili peppers, and other products to sell.  Her goal is to someday have the opportunity to expand her business even more so that she can provide better service to her customers.  

The other group members and their business activities are as follows:
• Yocunda sells groceries.
• Maria sells fish.
• Margarita sells fish.
• Natalia sells clothing.
• Rafael sells fish.
• Nohemi sells snacks.
• Maria Paula sells chickens.
• Alejandra sells groceries.
• Adela sells fish.
• Marcelino sells frozen popsicles.
• Angel Roberto sells fish.
• Maria sells fish.
• Jacqueline sells food.
• Luis sells groceries.
• Yadira sells groceries.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, canned foods, candy, detergent, soap, juices, soft drinks, beans, rice, sugar, cheese, cream, milk, chili peppers, and other products.

loans.name: Los 3 Manuel Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "Los 3 Manuel" y está conformado por tres hombres trabajadores humildes, indígenas y todos llevan el nombre Manuel, fue por eso que decidieron ponerle así a su grupo.

Juan Manuel, mejor conocido por el apodo de "Negro", se dedica a la venta de refacciones para autos, también tiene un taller mecánico en su casa, pero pronto lo cambiará de ubicación ya que en su casa no hay mucho espacio. Él inició su negocio gracias a su tío Luis quien puso su taller mecánico y compró las herramientas en un principio. Posteriormente, invitó a Juan Manuel a trabajar con él; entonces, él no sabía nada de mecánica, pero con el apoyo de su tío aprendió todo lo necesario y ahora incluso disfruta mucho su actividad, una prueba de ello es que pretende mejorar su negocio. Lo que más le gusta a el "Negro" es reparar los motores, mientras que lo que encuentra más difícil de sobrellevar es la competencia. Juan Manuel sabe que los demás mecánicos cobran más barato por reparar los carros y eso lo hace perder clientes. De acuerdo con sus propias palabras, las características que debe tener una persona para hacer el tipo de trabajo que desempeña es ser amable con los clientes, ser responsable para no dejar trabajo pendiente y honesto para reconocer cuando se equivoca y cuando el trabajo no es de la mejor calidad en lugar de decir que la refacción no tiene la suficiente calidad. Juan Manuel se considera una persona especial por sus ganas de superarse por trabajar para cumplir sus sueños. Uno de ellos es tener un taller mecánico más amplio así como todas las herramientas y piezas automotrices para dar un mejor servicio. El "Negro" pidió el crédito para comprar más refacciones automotrices.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:

Juan Manuel -se dedica a brindar servicio de mecánica.
José Manuel - se dedica a brindar servicio de mecánica.

Le dan las gracias a Vision Fund por ayudar a todos los hombres trabajadores con ganas de superarse.
texts.en:
This group is called "Los 3 Manuel" and it is made of up 3 indigenous men who are unassuming and hardworking.  They are all named Manuel, and so this is why they decided to name their group "The 3 Manuel."  

Juan Manuel, better known by the nickname "Negro," has a business selling auto parts, and he also has a mechanic's workshop in his house.  However, he will soon move the workshop to another location, because there is not a lot of space in his house.  He started his business thanks to his uncle Luis, who set up his mechanic's workshop and initially bought the tools.  Later, he invited Juan Manuel to work with him.  Back then, Juan Manuel  didn't know anything about mechanics, but with the support of his uncle he learned everything he needed to know, and now he enjoys this activity very much.  One challenge for him is that he wants to improve his business.  What "Negro" likes most is to repair motors, while what he finds most difficult is to deal with the competition.  Juan Manuel knows that the other mechanics charge less to repair cars, and this makes him lose customers.  According to his own words, the characteristics that a person must have to do this type of work are: they must be friendly with the customers, they must be responsible to not leave unfinished work, and they must be honest and recognize when they make a mistake and when the work is not of the best quality, instead of saying that the part is not of sufficient quality.   Juan Manuel is considered to be a special person because of his desire to excel in his work so that he can accomplish his dreams.  One of these is to have a bigger mechanic's workshop that is equipped with all of the tools and auto parts needed to provide better service.  "Negro" is requesting a loan to buy more automotive parts. 

 The other members of the group are: Juan Manuel: who provides mechanic's services, and Jose Manuel, who also provide mechanic's services. 

 They thank the Vision Fund for helping all of the hardworking men who want to succeed.

loans.use: to buy auto parts for his mechanic's workshop

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rope-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 21,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for her rope-making business.

NWTF is relisting Lolita's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a brave Lebanese young man. He’s 31 years old, and married to a beautiful and lovely woman. They have two school-aged children and live in their own house that is located in a one of the wonderful Lebanese villages. 

Hussein is the one and only source of income for his family. He has huge responsibilities especially for covering his children's study fees. In 2009, Hussein started to drive his own taxi. His job consists of transporting people to and from the airport upon request. He is sometimes obliged to leave his house at midnight in order to respond to his customers when they ask for his services. 

Because Hussein is facing some problems with his car, he requested to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on it in addition to paying  mechanic's fees. This is how Hussein works honestly, to keep his loyal customers. He really wishes to expand his work and buy a van to transport a wider range of clients.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Mien's Group

texts.en:
Mien was born in 1959. She is a member of Tien Kha cluster. She has a son. She and her husband are farmers. She not only grows rice and vegetables but she also raises chickens. Her son is a worker. He has an income. Her family has a monthly income of about 8,000,000 Vietnamdong. Mien has participated in SEDA since 2006. The last cycle she borrowed 6,758,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy feed for her chickens.

 About the borrowers in her group:

 Do is 60 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for her small business: buy more  scrap iron.

 Ha is 25 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy feed for chickens

loans.name: Varis

texts.en:
Varis is 55 years old, a married man with three children. He is a farmer and has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 20 years. He chose this business because it  is profitable and fresh produce is in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan family and also used to make fresh punch.

Varis sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 250 AZN. His son actively helps him to raise his crops.

As this produce is in high demand, Varis wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1500 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be his 2nd loan and he has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anahí Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Anahi y está conformado por siete personas originarias de un pequeño pueblo del estado de Oaxaca llamado El Ciruelo donde se celebra el tradicional día de muertos con la llamada "Danza de los Diablos".

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Ángela de 57 años de edad, quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesos desde hace nueve años. Dice que desde pequeña ya sabía como elaborar este producto lácteo ya que su mamá se dedicaba a la misma actividad y fue ella quien le enseñó todo sobre la preparación. Ángela está felizmente casada con el señor Dionisio quien se encarga de ir al campo ordeñar las vacas en la mañana para que la leche este lista y doña Ángela pueda elaborar sus quesos. Doña Ángela opina que las características que debe tener una persona para dedicarse a este tipo de actividad es ser una persona amable, higiénica, con un buen sazón para no pasar los quesos de sal y sobre todo ser una persona sencilla con los clientes ya que la mayoría de los mejores compradores son personas humildes. Una de sus más grandes satisfacciones es contar con la ayuda de Vision Found, ya que con su apoyo va poder comprar bandejas y un molino para la elaboración de quesos y así poder seguir con su negocio.

Las otras integrantes de este grupo son:

Ignacia Emperatriz - se dedica a la venta de quesos.
Juana – se dedica a la venta de quesos.
Cruz - se dedica a la venta de comida.
Alfredo - se dedica a la venta de fierro viejo.
Hortencia - se dedica a la venta de comida.
Eloina - se dedica a la venta de refrescos.

Le dan  las gracias a Vision Found  por ayudar a todas las personas que tienen deseos de engrandecer sus negocios para ofrecerles una mejor vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
This group is called Anahi and is made up of seven people from a small town in the state of Oaxaca called El Ciruelo where the traditional Day of the Dead is celebrated with the so-called Dance of the Devils.

One of the members of this group is Ángela, aged 57 years old, who for the last nine years has made her living producing and selling cheese. She says that when she was young, she already knew how to produce this dairy product as her mother worked in the same activity and it was her who taught her everything to do with preparation. Ángela is happily married with Dionisio who goes to the fields to milk the cows in the morning so that the milk is ready so that Ángela can make her cheese. Ángela believes that the characteristics a person must have to work in this type of business is to be a friendly and hygienic person with good sense of taste so as not to overpower the cheese with salt, and above all, to be an honest person with customers as most of the best buyers are humble people. One of her greatest sources of satisfaction is that relying on the help of Vision Found, because with its support, she will be able to buy cheeseboards and a mill to make cheeses and therefore be able to continue with her business.

The other members in this group are:

Ignacia Emperatriz - sells cheese for a living.
Juana – sells cheese for a living.
Cruz - sells food for a living.
Alfredo - sells scrap iron for a living.
Hortencia - sells food for a living.
Eloina - sells drinks for a living.

They thank Vision Found for helping all the people who wish to grow their businesses to offer their families a better life.

loans.use: to buy material to produce cheese.

loans.name: Grigoriy

texts.en:
Grigoriy is a farmer who grows strawberries on his small piece of land outside the city. He finds it difficult to farm because he does it by himself; however, his 18-year-old son offers to help whenever he can.

The cultivation of land for strawberries is a very difficult and labor intensive process. Currently, Grigoriy does not possess the means to hire anyone. In order to reduce the amount of manual labour required from himself and his son, Grigoriy is hoping to purchase agro film which will help by keeping the strawberry crop clean and helping to retain moisture in the soil from irrigation.

Grigoriy has two big dreams in his life. First, he wants to buy another piece of land some day and a greenhouse to grow more strawberries. Second, he dreams of finishing the building of his house.

Grigoriy's family needs you to help him finance the purchase of agro film and irrigation equipment.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment (agro film and irrigation equipment).

loans.name: Owen

texts.en:
At the age of 29, Owen is the proud owner of a small mobile money transfer business in the fishing and rice-growing town of Senanga. He is the first born in his family and has four siblings who all go to school.

Owen is a person who has grown in business. Before he had his own mobile money transfer shop, Owen worked for his father. He says working for his father taught him how to give customers the best possible service and how to develop friendships, both of which he says are important to making his business work. When Owen is not at his shop he is often found at church where he is a part-time pastor.

Owen’s business is located very close to the harbor. He says most of his customers are fishermen and rice growers who normally use his service to send and receive money for business purposes and for their children’s school fees among other things.  He is convinced that his customers love his business because it is convenient to use and cheaper than other money transfer services.

When asked what challenges he faces in his business, he cites low working capital as the major one. This, he says, is particularly a challenge when he has a lot of people who want to transact with him. However he is hopeful that once he gets a Kiva loan, he will be able to have more money in his business and be able to do more transactions. This will bring him a lot of joy because it will mean never having to ask another customer to wait to be served.

Being the first born in his family, Owen wants to lead as a role model for his younger siblings by succeeding at his business, and earn profits which he can use to send them to school.

In the video, a representative from Mobile Transactions is interviewing Owen.

loans.use: To have more money in his business and be able to attend to more customers

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en:
Yusufu is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya and is married with six children with the first-born being twelve years and the last-born being only nine months old. Yusufu is aged thirty-four and has been in farming for five years. He gets additional income from his motorcycle transport business.

Yusufu is has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He hopes he will grow his business to three dairy cows and generate enough income to educate his children and venture into more businesses to spread business risks currently in farming.

Yusufu says the major challenge in farming is currently in shortage of feeds which results in high costs.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica a cultivar maíz y Chile, vive con sus padres está casado y tiene dos hijos de 3 y 6 años de edad, desde muy joven aprendió el trabajo porque su padre se lo enseño, pero desde hace 10 años trabaja lo propio para cubrir sus necesidades.
El solicita un préstamo para comprarse foliares y abono, que son para preparar el terreno antes de sembrar el maiz y el chile, con  esto espera mejorar la condición de la tierra para que su producción sea mayor y sus cosechas sean sanas.
El sueño de Juan es poder estabilizar su situación económica, poderle ofrecer a su familia todo lo que necesite, y seguir trabajando arduamente.
texts.en:
Juan grows corn and chiles.  He lives with his parents, is married, and has two children aged 3 and 6.  From the time he was very young, his father taught him farming, but for the past 10 years he has worked on his own to support himself.
